meanings.definition: Not completely rigid; somewhat flexible or pliable.
meanings.sent1: The semirigid hose bent easily around the corner.
meanings.sent2: The semirigid plastic sheet could be slightly bent.
meanings.sent3: The semirigid ruler did a little dance on the desk.
meanings.sent4: His semirigid stance showed a hint of flexibility in his decision-making.
meanings.sent5: The semirigid tree branches swayed gently in the breeze.

meanings.definition: Having a degree of stiffness or firmness, but not completely rigid.
meanings.sent1: The semirigid wire held the shape well.
meanings.sent2: The semirigid mattress provided some support without being too hard.
meanings.sent3: The semirigid balloon refused to pop no matter how much he squeezed it.
meanings.sent4: Her semirigid expression softened slightly when she saw the puppy.
meanings.sent5: The semirigid door handle felt cold and unyielding in his hand.
